articles.author: Erica Reynolds The News-Review
articles.description: It’s the ending of an age for the YMCA of Douglas County. After 57 years, Peggy Konzack has retired from teaching swim lessons.
articles.title: Peggy Konzack, 104, retires from teaching swim lessons

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: For impoverished families, the holidays can be a challenge as seasonal obligations can pile stress onto regular struggles. But for families with students in Douglas County, things may be a little easier this season.
articles.title: Cow Creek Tribe donates $130,050 in student meal funds to Douglas County school districts

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: The smoke was visible as far as Winston, rising into the sky in a massive black cloud. At the scene, a crowd had gathered to watch, the heat radiating across the street as the building burned to the ground.
articles.title: Douglas County fire departments conduct joint live fire training exercise in Roseburg

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: SUTHERLIN — Terry Prestianni, Sutherlin School District superintendent, plans to retire at the end of the 2025-26 school year.
articles.title: Sutherlin begins search for new superintendent

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: CANYONVILLE — Javier and Carolina Rodriguez set up their booths next to each other but clearly separate. Hers displayed jewelry and dream catchers, while his hobby is finding old Native American paintings.
articles.title: Seven Feathers Resort Casino hosts Winter Gift Market

articles.description: Lucy Baldwin said she's been into music since she was 8 years old, but it has always been a part of her life.

articles.description: You may walk in looking to just ship a package or rent a mailbox. You may walk out with a PlayStation 3, a Luke Skywalker action figure, a bag of beef jerky and a Wheaties box signed by Jerry Rice.

articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — Both pasta and ideas were shared Saturday as residents of Southern Douglas County gathered to discuss developments related to an ongoing project for the community: The Riddle Activity Center (RAC).
articles.title: First ever Riddle Activity Center Community Spaghetti Feed held in Myrtle Creek

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A 21-year-old Roseburg man is facing attempted murder charges after detectives say he broke into a Myrtle Creek home and assaulted 73-year-old Stephen Balliew. The victim’s injuries did not match a reported fall, prompting a full investigation.
articles.title: 21-year-old Roseburg man charged with attempted murder after assault on elderly victim

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A late-night chase through Gaddis Park ended with the arrest of 49-year-old Joshua Frazier after police say he fled on a dirt bike and later crashed near the I-5 walking bridge. Officers found meth in his possession and confirmed he had an outstanding warrant.
articles.title: High-Speed Chase Through Gaddis Park Ends in Arrest of Roseburg Man

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Ingram Content Group is expanding its Roseburg workforce and hosting a job fair on Nov. 19 from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Nearly 60 positions are opening as the facility prepares for major growth in 2026. Applicants can learn more at ingramcareers.com.
articles.title: Ingram Content Group Expanding Hiring in Roseburg, Hosts Local Job Fair Nov. 19

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: ODOT plans to activate the new Oregon 42 traffic signal at Rolling Hills Road by Wednesday night. Lane closures continue as crews finish installation. The signal is part of an $11.97M safety and paving project, with more median improvements coming in the weeks ahead.
articles.title: New Traffic Signal at Highway 42 and Rolling Hills Road Expected to Go Live This Week
